title: Deploy the suite on GovCloud (FIPS mode)
content:
If you want to deploy the suite with FIPS mode enabled, you must use GovCloud. For information about the supported services and limitations of FIPS mode, see FIPS mode.

In this release, FIPS mode support is under controlled availability, where SMA Product Management will work with customers to review the planned implementation. Installing the suite with FIPS mode enabled requires more hardware resources than without FIPS mode enabled. Contact SMA Product Management before you start the implementation.

The following is the procedure to deploy the suite on GovCloud with FIPS mode enabled. In the tables below, the steps marked as Common apply to both non-FIPS and FIPS mode installation, and those marked as FIPS specific apply only to FIPS mode installation. 

Prepare

Complete these preparation tasks before installing the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform Note
1

Prepare a valid Docker Hub account to download the product images from Docker Hub.

Note: Skip if your deployment requires OMT, you will perform this step during the OMT installation.

 Any client that has Internet connectivity Any Activate your Docker Hub account Common
2

Download the cloud deployment package from the Marketplace.

 Any client that has Internet connectivity Any Download the cloud deployment package Common
3

Prepare your user account with the right permissions and a required key pair.

 AWS Management Console Cloud administrator Create AWS user policy and key pair Common
4 Create a FIPS-enabled AMI. Any client that has Internet connectivity Cloud administrator Create FIPS-enabled AMI FIPS specific
5

Prepare a Virtual Private Cloud where you will place all the other resources.

 AWS Management Console IT / Network administrator Prepare VPC (FIPS mode) FIPS specific
6

Create an EKS cluster and then launch the EKS cluster worker nodes to use Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) to install and manage the suite on AWS.

 AWS Management Console IT / Kubernetes Cluster administrator Build EKS cluster (FIPS mode) FIPS specific
7

Create and configure a bastion node to communicate with the Kubernetes cluster and we use it for the suite installation and troubleshooting.

 AWS Management Console and bastion node IT / Server administrator Configure bastion Common
8 To create a subnet for secondary network interfaces, you will need to configure custom networking to associate different security groups to the secondary network interfaces. AWS Management Console and bastion node IT / Server administrator Configure custom networking Common
9 Download ESM chart package Bastion node  Suite administrator Download ESM chart package Common
10

If you wish to use a static persistent volume, create an AWS EFS instance to store the suite data on AWS, and then configure EFS volumes. 

 AWS Management Console and bastion node Storage administrator Configure EFS Common
11

Prepare an RDS instance as an external database server the suite in a production environment.

 AWS Management Console and bastion node Database administrator Launch RDS Common
12

Download the required images and upload them to a registry.

 Bastion node  Suite administrator Transfer images to a registry Common

Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT)

If you wish to use the OMT AppHub for any stage in your deployment, you need to first install OMT.

Skip this step if you don't require OMT for your deployment, and you need to enable the OMT Tools capability on your bastion node. See Enable the Tools capability on a new bastion node.

The link in the table takes you to the OMT documentation. In the OMT documentation, follow the steps required for external (Azure) Kubernetes only. After completing the OMT installation, return to this page to install the SMA suite.

Task Where to perform Role How to perform
Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT). Bastion Suite administrator Install OMT on an external K8s

Note that the OMT documentation contains information related to other deployments and is not SMA-specific. Pay attention to the following while using the document:

  1. Refer to the specifications listed in Support matrix for AWS deployment and Plan the deployment for both the suite and OMT.
  2. For information relating to Kubernetes, perform only the steps for AWS.
  3. When preparing an external database, skip the option for Oracle and ipv6 as they are currently not supported by SMA.
  4. When completing the OMT post-upgrade tasks, skip the task for configuring load balancers. You will perform this task using SMA-specific steps provided when installing SMA.

Install the suite

Complete these tasks to install the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform Note
1

Create an Application Load Balancer (ALB) controller.

 Bastion node  Suite administrator Configure Application Load Balancer Common
2 Create a new deployment for ESM. Bastion node  Suite administrator Create a new deployment for ESM Common
3 Prepare persistent volumes for ESM. Bastion node  Suite administrator Prepare persistent volumes for ESM Common
4 Perform pre-installation checks Bastion node  Suite administrator Perform pre-installation checks Common
5

Install the suite using CLI.

To install using CLI, you'll have to first Create my-values.yaml.

 Bastion node Suite administrator

Install ESM using CLI

 Common
Install the suite using AppHub. AppHub Installation portal Suite administrator Install ESM using AppHub Common
6 Create an Ingress for the Suite Bastion node  Suite administrator

Create an Ingress for the Suite

 Common
7 Verify the installation. Bastion node Suite administrator Verify ESM installation Common
8

Perform database-related and tuning tasks after installation.

 Database server and bastion node Database administrator and suite administrator Post-installation tasks Common

Set up tenants

After installing the suite, perform the following initial setup tasks to use the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Tasks for suite administrators to perform in Suite Administration.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Tenant setup tasks for suite administrators
2

Tasks for tenant administrators to perform in Service Management.

 Service Management Tenant administrators Tenant setup tasks for tenant administrators

Enable Native SACM

In addition, you can optionally install and enable the Native Service Asset & Configuration Management (SACM) solution after the suite deployment. Native SACM is one single solution for the entire Service Asset & Configuration Management process with instant access to the data and embedded graphical widgets for CI topology representation. 

Skip this section if you don't want to use the Native SACM solution.

Install Containerized UD/UCMDB on GovCloud, and then configure and enable Native SACM after the suite deployment.

Task Where to perform Role How to perform
Install Containerized UD/UCMDB on GovCloud in FIPS mode AWS Management Console and bastion node IT / Kubernetes Cluster administrator
Storage administrator
Suite administrator		 (Optional) Install containerized UD/UCMDB on GovCloud (FIPS mode)

Enable Native SACM by using the UCMDB Gateway.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Enable Native SACM
